Definition: (of a person) Having affection or warm regard; loving; fond
A person in whom one can confide or share one's secrets: a friend
Appreciative; thankful
Not at war or disturbed by strife or turmoil
To interact socially
To stir the emotions of
To infuse into the mind; to communicate to the spirit; to convey, as by a divine or supernatural influence; to disclose preternaturally; to produce in, as by inspiration
Feeling or causing joy
To cheer, to cheer up, to gladden, to make happy
To renew or revitalize
Someone who is hoping for success or victory, especially as a candidate in a political election
usually used predicatively, not attributively, be afraid) Impressed with fear or apprehension; in fear
To puzzle, perplex, baffle, bewilder (somebody)
To humiliate; to disrupt somebody's composure or comfort with acting publicly or freely; to disconcert; to abash
Any of the forms of a verb which distinguish when an action or state of being occurs or exists
To disturb or irritate, especially by continued or repeated acts; to bother with unpleasant deeds
To sever or interrupt a connection
A weariness caused by exertion; exhaustion
More or most likely to be exposed to the chance of being attacked or harmed, either physically or emotionally
Displaying or feeling anger
Lack of quiet; absence of tranquility in body or mind
An ache or bodily suffering, or an instance of this; an unpleasant sensation, resulting from a derangement of functions, disease, or injury by violence; hurt
Opposition or repugnance of mind; fixed dislike
To make melancholy; to sadden or grieve (someone)
